                                                Locator Resources National level Policy State level Policies Electricity Cost for charging Standards and Specifications Reports and Articles Media Useful Links Skill Centre International Best Practices on Policies Template for State Level EV Awareness portal Support FAQs Share Your Content ZEVTC Declaration Zero-Emission Vehicle Transition Council (ZEVTC) brings together
                        ministers and representatives of some of the world’s
                        largest automobile markets to collectively address key challenges in the transition to ZEVs, to
                        enable faster, cheaper, and easier transition to EVs for all. On Transport Day at COP26, India, represented by NITI Aayog,
                        participated in the fourth ministerial dialogue of the ZEVTC, a global forum on enhancing
                        political cooperation on the transition to zero-emission vehicles. Several
                        stakeholders—automotive manufacturers, governments, businesses, fleet owners, etc.—made the
                        declaration to actively work towards the proliferation and adoption of zero emission vehicles. ZEVTC Declaration Signatories Governments in emerging markets and developing countries Government of India Cities, states and regional governments Government of Sikkim Automotive Manufacturers Fleet owners and operators, or shared mobility platforms Other signatories Is your organization interested to become the signatory member of
                        this declaration?
